text: [Music]
I like the way you put that Opera is the
medium that tries to embrace everything
to do everything uh
and if you do it right if you keep all
the different parts in Balance uh it's a
juggling act but you know there's really
nothing much more exciting than a really
good juggling act when there are about
15 balls in the air I've always loved
Opera it never occurred to me that I
would write an opera labretto the reason
why it happened was one of my closest
friends is a composer Paul morvi and uh
a few years ago uh Paul and I were at
lunch he's a neighbor of mine on the
upper west side and I we were sitting at
lunch and I said to him you really ought
to write an opera and I ticked off the
reasons why he should do this his music
was inherently dramatic he wrote well
for voices you know things like that so
he says very casually to me I'll do it
if you'll write the lbr
well little did I know that within a
couple of years we would end up getting
a commission from the Santa Fe Opera to
write an opera together the letter which
turned out to be so they tell us the
most successful commissioned Opera in
the history of the Santa Fe Opera uh we
are uh hoping to write more operas we're
talking to other companies about
commissions uh it was a completely
unexpected thing for me I have not since
the days when I was a performing
musician have I thought of myself as a
creative artist a Critic is not a
creative artist he's a commenter a
midwife of of creativity but not
creative himself uh baling George baling
the choreographer would have said he's
like an angel he carries the message but
doesn't experience it uh and then
suddenly here I am writing a labretto
and it worked I mean the reason why it
worked is because I was working with a
great composer but I had learned a lot
about what works on stage from spending
six years seeing two or three plays a
week you know if you don't learn
something from that experience you're
not paying attention um and it was fun
it was fun to be on the other side of
the curtain it was fun to see a director
Jonathan Kent whom I had praised to the
skies in my capacity as a Critic working
on my material and seeing how he did it
direction is the most invisible part of
the theatrical art you don't see it it's
not like the conductor in a symphony
orchestra performance because he's
standing in front of you waving his arms
you know what he's doing you don't know
what the director is doing unless you
know a lot about theater and even then
you can only deduce it you know it when
you go to the rehearsal you really know
it when they're rehearsing something of
yours I learned more in the rehearsals
for the letter than I have ever dreamed
of knowing about theater as a Critic if
it doesn't make me a better critic I'm
an
idiot the most important thing to
remember is that the composer is the
senior
partner you cannot force a subject on a
composer if if it doesn't Inspire him he
has to take the lead you are an enabler
you are creating the enabling conditions
under which he can write great music
your words are
secondary many librettists in Opera
collaborations of the past have
forgotten this or not known it or
refused to accept it uh and they try to
get out in front of the creative process
and it just doesn't work that way now
Paul and I are old friends we really
understand each other and Paul not being
a theater
person would always trust me when I said
things to him like you're going to need
another 10 seconds of Music here to get
them across the stage but at the same
time uh I always knew that the people
weren't going to be coming to this Opera
to hear my
words they were going to be coming to
hear his music of which my words would
be a part and had there ever been a
major dispute in our collaboration and
there never was I would have yielded to
him I might have tried to make my point
but if it was clear that he wanted to go
in Direction a and I wanted to go in
Direction B we would have gone in
Direction a that's the most important
piece of advice I can give to anybody
who finds themselves in an opera or a
musical comedy situation like that
